p: To measure student and teacher beliefs in AGW, we used two items from one of the only published instruments used with both adult and adolescent populations [ 29]. One item measured whether students and teachers thought GW was happening and another measured whether they thought it was human caused ( Table 1). We measured climate change knowledge among students with a modified version of the climate knowledge scale in Tobler et al. [ 30], which addresses climate science, causes, and impacts ( Table 2). We pretested this instrument with 92 middle school students as outlined in Stevenson et al. [ 9]. We asked students to give written and verbal feedback when taking the instrument and conducted nine cognitive interviews [ 31] to elicit further general feedback on question wording and test alternative wording of questions when appropriate.
